channel.title: Killing a process using your server?
channel.description:
Ive came up with this great way to kill the server and restart if your server is already running. I will explain in dialouge.
Billys server is already running.
He compiles.
But he forgets to close the server.
He runs it, but it says its already running.
But with my code, it ends it, restarts and it's ready to go.
Ive got everthing working except killing the server prosscess ive tried clienthandler closes, servershutdown, ect. When i close the other server window it does restart.
What im trying to say is there a way to kill a computer task using the servers code?
~Val~

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

It has to be with the server that way if other java is running such as a client it wont end it.

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Why does it have to be coded into the server? That closes the old window and runs the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:4, topic:328285”]Try this…

@echo off Title Running Server TASKKILL /F /IM java.exe /T Java -Xmx200m server

The downside to this is that it will close the server, but also any other Java apps your running.[/quote]

I needs to be in server.java ill post my code momentarly.

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Try this…

@echo off Title Running Server TASKKILL /F /IM java.exe /T Java -Xmx200m server

The downside to this is that it will close the server, but also any other Java apps your running.

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

I have and it doesn’t work :).

Ill explain a little more.

Window A and Window B.

Window A (runserver prompt) is already running.

You load up window B

B needs to close A.

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?

item.title: Killing a process using your server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Dont suppose you considered this, its in server.java

public void killServer() { try { shutdownClientHandler = true; if (clientListener != null) clientListener.close(); clientListener = null; } catch (java.lang.Exception __ex) { __ex.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Killing a process using your server?
